Reviews.Title: UNLESS YOU REQUIRE A TRULY TELEPHOTO LENS AND BILL BOARD SIZED PRINTS THIS IS FAR MORE CAMERA THAN YOU WILL NEED
Reviews.Author: C. Scanlon "least helpful reviewer"
Reviews.Content: This is a professional camera capable of crystal clear prints worthy of publication or gallery display, up to 16x20.And it is incredibly inexpensive for a camera of such value.Ok, so its 3.6 optical zoom won't pick sand off an eagle's beak at a thousand yards. Okay, so it won't blow up to billboard size without loss of definition. In the real world however and everyday use this is a fine and professional level camera that will do a far better job than you expected. Better than a cell-phone.Disguised as a point and shoot. That's what makes it very effective; people are not intimidated by it. You can get right up to them, and it looks like any other camera. Yet, it is more.In fact, the generous three inch LCD screen means you do not have to hold it to your face. There is no optical viewfinder in any case. So you can hold it at your hip and glance down at it to compose, and snap shots while engaging the subject in small talk comfortably. I have done this effectively with Tarahumara Indian children in northern Chihuahua who normally run quickly from any camera. It works, and came out great. And that large LCD screen has a high-contrast, anti-reflection coating which keeps it clear even in strong sunlight.This camera is an improvement over the earlier, wonderful Coolpix, such as the great 8 megapix Nikon Coolpix L18 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Ruby Red) mainly because it has ten megapix capability. The earlier accessories such as the AC adapter, the  Nikon EH-65A AC Adapter, are transferable if you have a long shoot to do in one place (like a schoolful of children, which I have done) or other reason to go off-battery. Nevertheless, a pair of Energizer® e<sup>2</sup>® "AA" Lithium Batteries For digital cameras, portable audio players, and more last in here last forever.Your old Coolpix camera pouch also still fits; use it and protect your investment. I like the Rokinon Compact Digital Camera Padded Carrying Case for Canon Powershot, Casio Exilim, Fuji Finepix, (GE) General Electric, Kodak EasyShare, Nikon Coolpix, Olympus FE Stylus, Panasonic Lumix, Pentax Optio, Sony CyberShot and Samsung Digital Cameras.Also new here, aside from the greater megapixels, is the new Expeed image processing system specially fine-tuned for the Coolpix series "to render natural-looking pictures of incredible quality and quick response" as if the earlier system of digital processing was not fine enough! Amateur enthusiasts will find their photos reaching a new magnitude of quality; even the professional will leave his camera bag and lenses at home (okay, so she might miss her long lens, but macro here gets in to two inches).The ISO settings are phenomenal, stretching from 64 ISO all  the way out to 1600. Over twenty years ago when I was doing photo-journalism in Nicaragua, we used 64 for our slide film and 1600 was just coming on the horizon, very grainy but with a special charm for low light situations, like oil lamp, etc. Here you can do very low light and candlelight  (if you do not mind some grain effect), and in fact there are special pre-sets which employ the faster ISO's effectively.This is another expansion over the prior Coolpix L series. You can choose instead of Auto (with own its user-selected options) to use the pre-set "Scene" selections quickly and efficiently. The Scene modes now include: Portrait, Night Portrait, Sports, Landscape, Party, Beach/Snow, Sunset, Dusk/Dawn, Night Landscape, Museum, Fireworks Show, Close Up, Copy, Back Light, Panorama Assist, Food. Food is one of the new ones, and you food photo-journalists might want to try it very inexpensively yet quite well here. The rest of the modes you can figure how they are set from the title and how you might apply their settings to similar situations; know that the Nikon impression of party might be much more sedate and candle-lit than the Animal House idea. This is not cheating, to use pre-sets; this is using the tool that you have in the way it was designed. Cheating would be setting this to its auto-scene setting in which it selects the Scene mode according to prevailing conditions, automatically. Yes, this can do it.The panorama assist is great. You can take a series of photos in a row in either of four directions (left to right, up and down, etc.) overlapping by one third (I really appreciate the rule of thirds grid which you can bring up on the LCD, keeping the camera straight and well composed), and then unite them with the included software into one long (or tall) file. I had reason to do this the other day at a long new school. Things do not build vertical out here in the desert, but there is plenty of room for horizontal, and a special Cinerama style long photo framing. In fact you could line up your whole town along the sidewalk standing and take one long photo of everyone in town. Just find printer and paper!With the built in macro mode you can jump right into that cactus blossom from two inches away and have perfect focus. Take a photo of that baby's toes and blow them up to 16x20. Come in close to that ant stealing cracker crumbs on your picnic. This strength of macro was recently unimaginable, and yet here you have this power within a humble, tiny and inexpensive package.What I really love and appreciate is the SDHC compliancy. I can use as standard memory card a regular Sandisk 4GB Secure Digital SD HC Memory Card (SDSDB-4096, BULK, No Reader) and have room for 500 shots at maximum resolution. You can truly, as we used to say a quarter century ago "shoot a roll; keep a shot."  Take all of the shots you can, and then pick one out to use and delete the rest. For someone who used to burn through boxes of film (at 36 shots each max) and then do the darkroom processing all night, and then find a free way to get more, this is like living in another, finer dimension. Of course, you can put even larger SD HC memory cards in here and if you ever do fill one up and have nothing more to put in there and no time to delete, this camera comes with a generous 20MB internal memory on hand.You can hook it up to the USB port of a computer directly and use the included software, or simply pop out the SD card and plug it into a reader and into the computer. Whatever works for you, although I do not like opening and closing the battery/card hatch too much. It is very strong and durable, but in the olden days I had a habit of snapping such things and putting them back together with duct tape. This one looks remarkably resilient nevertheless and has stood up to me.Speaking of shooting a roll to get the one picture, have you ever taken a shot to discover your subject blinked? This camera lets you know. Yes, this camera sees when your subject blinks, and lets you know, using the Smart Portrait system. It also automatically fixes your red-eye special. You'll never see red eye again. It finds faces, and automatically focuses on them, up to a dozen at a time. It can also snap the shutter automatically when someone finally dares to smile. And the D-lighting will save those details otherwise lost in darkness.As you can see, this camera does everything for you but serve as photo agency selling your work to Vogue or GQ. A great camera at a small price. What can go wrong?The most amazing thing for me, of course, an old still shooter, is that this tiny camera is also a video camera, with built in mike, and a built in speaker for playback. You can make movies with this at two different resolutions, either for television playback at 640x480 or laptop at 320x240 (good for e-mailing). These home movies are truly sharp, with the same excellent back to front focus as the photos, and surprisingly high quality sound. The length of the movie is limited only to the size of your SDHC card; you could easily go for feature length! Using .AVI files, it can easily be edited as well.Hey, for the same price, this is way better than a cell phone!

Reviews.Title: A Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: carlitos_92
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on past experiences with Coolpix cameras, and the L20 carries most of what I've liked into the 10-megapixel line.  Some pros and cons:* The use of normal AA batteries is probably the best feature of this camera.  It keeps the L20 from being a super-slim, sexy piece of jewelry, but the importance of being able to keep inexpensive spare batteries around, or of being able to just run into a drugstore and buy more batteries in a pinch, is not to be underestimated.  I usually use NiMH rechargeables (Kodak brand at the moment, but I have also used Energizer) and have had no problems with the camera.* The easy-auto mode of the camera pretty much does all the thinking for you.  Occasionally, I will switch to macro mode or the scene used for backlit objects, but other than that, it's strictly point-and-shoot.* Low-light pictures come out grainier than I would like, but that is to be expected with this level of product.* My biggest gripe is that Nikon decided to put the SD card slot behind the battery door.  I believe they did this to cut down the number of breakable doors on the camera, but I much preferred being able to easily get to the SD card, since I have readers in my PC and laptop.  I have almost never used the supplied USB cables for image transfer.  Since the battery door is a bit balky, I am afraid that since I'm going to be going in there a lot for the SD card, it is prone to break even more than a standalone door would be.  This is not a deal-breaker, but I think Nikon took a step backward.All in all, I am pleased with Amazon's pricing and service, as usual.  The Nikon L20 is a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L20: a good point-&-shoot camera
Reviews.Author: R. Moorleghen
Reviews.Content: I would have to say that I found the L20 to be an all-around great point-&shoot; camera. The controls are very user friendly, the picture quality is good, & the video feature is nice. I especially like the 3" LCD screen; the bigger the screen the better.One feature some might love but others may not is that the camera uses AA batteries. this makes the camera more versatile in a situation where one is out of power &/or forgot their battery. I have come around to argue that this is a great feature if one also gets rechargeable batteries with a recharger.In conclusion I will simply say that I would definitely recommend this to a friend.

Reviews.Title: My father loved it.
Reviews.Author: Hugo M. M. Rabson
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my father as a birthday gift. He loved it.He has been using it underground (he is an avid spelunker / cave radio enthusiast) and overground (he loves railways). He lives in France with my mother; thanks to this camera, I can now see how lovely their garden is.This camera made my father happy. Therefore, I give it five stars. :)

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Lucygoosey
Reviews.Content: Works great for a point and shoot camera. I could do with even less choices of settings, take a lot of playing around to find the one you want. Nice crisp prictures. Bounces well when you drop it  :-)

Reviews.Title: Very Cool Coolpix
Reviews.Author: S. Rey
Reviews.Content: This little camera is amazing!  It is very easy to use and very user-friendly.  I haven't read the entire manual yet and each time I use it I find another valuable function.  I just found out that you can zoom in on an existing picture and save it as another photo - truly amazing!  The video portion is handy although I have not had the opportunity to use it just yet.  The software is extremely user-friendly as well.  It only uses 2 AA batteries and they last for quite a while.  A very good buy and a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon the Great!
Reviews.Author: K. Fleming
Reviews.Content: This little camera is Wonderful! It takes great pictures, the features are smart and easy to use and most of all It's a great Value! I didn't install the software but Nikon has never disappointed me.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L20
Reviews.Author: Kaz Lady
Reviews.Content: Very good looking camera. I love the style of it and the color.I decided to change brands and go with Nikon, who is suppose to be known for cameras.  The settings are real easy, but the problem I had, no matter how steady I hold the camera, there is a slight blur to it.  I have tryed all the modes, such as dusk, closeup, etc.  And than go back to easy mode to shot pictures.  They are not crystal clear.  They are not as  sharp, as I thought they would be.  There alot better camera's, such as Kodak, for the same price that take alot better picture.The software, View NX is awful, along with picturetown.  Not very user friendly for downloading your pics. Sure the pictures go to View NX, but the tools that are with that software do not work well to improve your photo.I was very bummed that Nikon did not live up the their standard.I will be returning this camera, since the pictures are not up to my standard.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, Excellent quality
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It was Murphy's Law -- our digital camera died two days before our big vacation.  I didn't have time to do a lot of research, I just needed another camera.  The local camera stores were too pricey, and the staff at the big box stores were useless when it came to helping me select a camera.These are the times when I love Amazon.  I was able to sort by price, read comments, and order with 1-day delivery.  Our camera arrived less than 12 hours before our flight departed and I'm thrilled to say that the camera performed beautifully, right out of the box.Loved the "easy auto" settings, as well as the ability to switch to more manual-style controls to account for sunsets, water glare, overcast skies, etc.  The only bad photos out of the batch were the ones when someone stepped into the frame!We're pretty camera-savvy, so I didn't install the software.  Instead, we simply pop out the memory card and use the slot on our laptop to download photos.One note:  I probably missed this in my haste, but since this camera comes with internal memory, the package does not include an SD card.  Luckily for us, we had a 2 GB card from our deceased camera and were able to reformat it for the Nikon.Bottom line:  a great value, excellent photos, easy to carry in a jeans pocket, and lightening-fast delivery thanks to Amazon!  I'd definitely recommend this camera for a no-hassle vacation memory-maker.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix L20
Reviews.Author: Alan B. Bowen
Reviews.Content: Very good camera. Has lots of different menus and options. Helps novice take good pictures. Pretty easy to use, very easy to upload.

Reviews.Title: Definitely a Coolpix
Reviews.Author: D. Romines
Reviews.Content: Good little point and shoot.  Amazing amount of software comes with this camera to manipulate your pics and video.

Reviews.Title: Great carryalong when travelling
Reviews.Author: Ron R. Nath "ron"
Reviews.Content: A recent airplane trip and it's restrictions on carry-on luggage sent me looking for a small camera because my Nikon D-40 DSLR and it's extra lenses were going to be too much of a hassle. (I should mention I will use here at home on my motorcycle trips because, once again, the DSLR and it's lenses are too bulky - and expensive - to risk losing or damaging.)I went for the Coolpix because my experience with Nikon equipment has been very good.I was not surprised by the limited telephoto capabilities, but very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the enlargements I got from it's 10 megapixel shots. At 8x10 in size they were the equal of anything I ever got from film cameras.It's small size made it an easy fit in the side pocket of the jacket I was wearing.The included software featured a "stitching" program so I tried that out and was very pleased with the panoramic shots I got of the Seattle downtown and shoreline.The camera did not include an SD card, but I knew that when I bought it. So I picked up a 4 gig card and when I saw it was capable of holding over a thousand pictures at the highest resolution I knew I was set for the trip.While I prefer the Nikon DSLR I have, this little L20 Coolpix was a good buy for me and well worth the under $100 I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA FOR A FIRST TIME DIGITAL CAMERA OWNER.
Reviews.Author: Michelle R. Sherer
Reviews.Content: THIS WAS A GIFT FOR MY 9 YEAR OLD GRANDDAUGHTER'S BIRTHDAY.  SHE LOVED THE DARK BLUE COLOR AND THE EASE OF USING IT...AS SHE GETS COMFORTABLE WITH THE CAMERA, SHE WILL BE ABLE TO USE ALL THE SETTINGS THAT ARE AVAILABLE...THEY ARE VERY EASY TO SELECT, AND THAT GIANT SCREEN FOR VIEWING IS JUST FABULOUS...I PLAYED WITH IT AND JUST LOVED ALL THE THINGS YOU CAN CHOOSE...ALSO THE FACT THAT IT USES 2 AA BATTERIES WAS A GREAT FEATURE, BUT THE BATTERIES DIDN'T SEEM TO LAST TOO LONG...I DON'T KNOW IF THIS WILL BE A COMMON THING, OR SHE JUST SNAPPED SO MANY PICTURES THE FIRST WEEK.  TIME WILL TELL WITH THAT...I AM PLANNING ON BUY MYSELF A COOLPIX CAMERA IN THE NEAR FUTURE.

Reviews.Title: Great Value & Portability
Reviews.Author: Marty from Scarsdale "Hands on guy"
Reviews.Content: Although this is my first personal digital camera, I have used my wife's camera for several years but got tired of losing editorial control...no different from the TV remote control. You husbands will understand.I actually bought this model in September as a 9th birthday gift for my grandson and he immediately began using it without the need to read the instructions. Kids...That impressed me so I bought the same Coolpix L20 for myself to use on long distance bicycle trips as well as supplementing our family digital camera. I too was able to learn its method of operation with minimal assistance from the users manual and even found some great features which the 9 year old hasn't yet discovered. The idea was for us to have the same camera so we could teach each other how best to use it.I've used my Coolpix L20 now for a month and really love it's simplicity and ease of use, even taking videos. Its 10 MP chip provides plenty of data with which to edit and store great pictures. However, the delay in acquiring data to the memory card makes taking action shots such as sporting events nearly impossible. You will get blured pictures 90% of the time. Acquiring jpegs to your desk top is simple once you load the Nikon software. Be sure to temporarily disable the anti virus software first. Best of all, the Coolpix L20 is lightweight and easily stores in your pocket and I like the fact that it runs on AA batteries. And I was amazed at how inexpensive it was. It will be a perfect camera to supplement our existing one.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: A. S. Montgomery "outdoors boy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 8 year old son, he has taken some phenomenal photos with it.  He has dropped it and treated it like you would expect an 8 year old to treat anything.  The camera still continues to function.  Really like the AA batteries, you can buy those anywhere, it is more expensive than recharging but face it, you don't always remember the charger.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera Handicapped by Lousy Battery Drain
Reviews.Author: Bhavik H. Soni "Big B"
Reviews.Content: I'd ordered this camera as a starter camera for my 10 year old son to take with him on holiday. After explaining how it works to him, I handed over the camera, rechargeable battery and charger to him. A week later, we complained that the battery was draining out too fast. I tried it ad found that the battery was indeed draining rapidly. I'm using two brand new Sanyo Ni-Mh 2100 batteries which drain out in the camera if left for 4 days! I even tried regular supermarket batteries but with similar disappointment.To summarize, I don't regret buying a Nikon but I do regret buying a pencil battery camera.

Reviews.Title: A ok camera.  Good price. But the LCD is blurry.
Reviews.Author: J. Zhang
Reviews.Content: The only problem with this unit is the quality of the LCD is no good at all.  After I took a picture, the LCD shows a very fuzzy preview of the picture.  I thought,  hmm,  what's the problem ? So I took another onen. Still the same.  I downloaded both pictures to my computer and they are actually very good pictures.  It is the problem if the LCD itself.I thought it is just the problem of this particular camera so I ordered another one from Amazon. Unfortunately both are the same.I guess this model's LCD is some how has lower quality(or lower pixel) than others.

Reviews.Title: Sent to Iraq, husband disappointed
Reviews.Author: A. Phifer "A. Phifer"
Reviews.Content: I recently sent this camera to my husband in Iraq. I bought it based on other reviews I read on Amazon. My husband received the camera and was disappointed in it. He said the zoom was "Terrible" and unless your hand is completely still, the pictures turn out blurry.

Reviews.Title: Inconsistancy at Best
Reviews.Author: Roffy
Reviews.Content: This camera can do some things well and is deficient in others. The macro feature takes very good photos but pictures taken with the easy shoot mode for distances of about 10 feet are lacking in clarity. Also, the color rendition is often inaccurate. The on-screen options are difficult to understand when the camera is taken off the easy shoot mode.

Reviews.Title: Nikon L20
Reviews.Author: M. MacDonald
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed several cameras and found the L20 was always rated very well.  So far, the pictures that I have taken turned out very nice.  The many available features allow you to make your picture or video look like a professional job.I am looking forward to using this camera for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Good Pictures
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Daniels
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera at another online site, was a bit cheaper. I love this camera, its very easy to use and has decent pictures. Batteries don't seem to last long even duracell. Maybe its just me but it sure seems like they drained really fast.Came with a software disc, cord to plug into your computer and a wrist strap. Really like the LCD on this Nikon, some you can't see anything in the sun, with this one I can. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: terrible service/quality
Reviews.Author: Laurie A. Gootee "pursuit of quality"
Reviews.Content: Battery door broke after just a few uses. Camera unusable. Called service number which was a waste of my time. No help at all.  Expected better service out of Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Really Enjoy it
Reviews.Author: K. Magnuson "K Mag"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 8 year old daughter for Christmas since she is obsessed with taking pictures.  It is so much better than my camera.  The picture quality is great.  Easy for an 8 year old to figure out without the directions.  Takes video too which was a bonus for her.

Reviews.Title: So-So
Reviews.Author: Art Daedelow
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for quality pictures invest more money and purchase a higher quality camera.  This camera is adequate for my needs as I purchased it for one reason... to be able to put it in my jacket pocket and take pictures while on motorcycle rides.  For that purpose the camera does as advertised.I will say the camera arrived in good order and delivery was extremely prompt.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: ljvirgo
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, and great purchase.  Bought it for my senior parents and they are enjoying it very much.

Reviews.Title: Not so great
Reviews.Author: Katherine Lavelle
Reviews.Content: Mine worked great for a few months back in 2009 and then it totally crapped out. Every photo was blurry and colors came out terrible.

Reviews.Title: Bought this on sale... good buy
Reviews.Author: Sowmya Ragavan
Reviews.Content: Bought this for 99 USD and it was a good buy for the most part. Only issue -- the AA battery slots are loose.Sometimes if the battery moves while you are travelling, the camera says it is out of charge which really isnt true. I guess that is the price you pay for 99 bucks.

Reviews.Title: moms likes it
Reviews.Author: Cass
Reviews.Content: My mom is pretty happy with this camera. I would never purchase it because it is too bulky and the quality of pictures is just okay; however, she wanted it and she is happy.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality photos
Reviews.Author: Ashlee B Spencer
Reviews.Content: I got this for my parents who don't have many electronics. It works fine for them when they just want a picture, but the lighting has to be just right or the quality is really poor. Indoor pictures are not good at all. Ideally this is an outdoor camera. Other than that it works great!

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn P
Reviews.Content: We like this camera, but I think if we had to do it again, we'd find one with the rechargable option and not the batteries.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: oneofsix
Reviews.Content: my 13 year old got this for his birthday and he loves it. easy to use and holds up well. arrived quickly.

Reviews.Title: Great little unit!
Reviews.Author: amphibiac
Reviews.Content: You couldn't get more camera for the price when we bought this for our daughter. Great little camera until she dropped it in the driveway and it got run over by the UPS truck. Can't expect a warranty to cover that!

Reviews.Title: It has some problems
Reviews.Author: somegirl
Reviews.Content: I have some problems with this camera, because sometimes it just stop working, and does not allow me to view pictures, take pictures or even turn it of, in order to make the camera to react again I have to take out the batteries and put them into the camera again, it's a pretty annoying problem.And the other thing is that the pictures are kind of blury, no matter how mode I use.It's compact and ok in general, I don't know if the problem it's only in the one I have or other people have the same problem.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Walter Mccurley
Reviews.Content: Camera works well for its intended purpose.  Mainly to take photos of items around the household and family and friends.  Easy to use.  Only complaint is camera is slow to take a picture so not sure this camera is designed for fast action events.

Reviews.Title: Not so good
Reviews.Author: J. Thomas
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is good. The only thing I disliked is it doesn't have a rechargeable battery. So one needs to use AA battery. This means on the long run we have to spend a lot for the battery

Reviews.Title: NIKON Coolpix L20
Reviews.Author: Juergen Pfeiffer
Reviews.Content: Terrific product!Excellent performance, takes great pictures and has excellent features.Product exceeds expectations and shipped on time.Great value for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: S. Girault
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter for Christmas. She took it out of the box, inserted the batteries and the memory card (that I purchased separately) and started taking pictures. Very easy to use, even for a 12 year old! Within minutes she was trying all of the features which were easy to figure out. Well made camera, which is typical for Nikon. The deep blue color is very "rich" looking.

Reviews.Title: Cool Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Rustic Foxtrot "Ron"
Reviews.Content: Purchased two L20's as Christmas presents for my grandchildren.  They really like them and had them up and running during the opening of the other Christmas presents by family members.  Cool enough for the grandchildren says a lot.

Reviews.Title: Spoiled Nikon users
Reviews.Author: T. Cahill
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera as a temporary while our Nikon D40 was being repaired.  We are spoiled camera users, so we were not happy with menu options or delay between pictures.  I will say the pictures once downloaded onto our computer were decent quality in comparison to what is displayed on the camera while taking the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great starter camera but defective
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Perfect starter camera for a tween or teen.  Picture, video capability with nice big LCD screen, takes AA batteries and your average run of the mill SD card.  Picture quality is quite nice.  4/5 stars.The one we received is defective.  It freezes up when using the picture playback option and the only way to get it unstuck is to remove the batteries.  Amazon accepted it for a full refund and we will be sending it back tomorrow; could not exchange due to being "unavailable" at the time I placed the call to customer service (although the exact same one WAS available in red but was at a cheaper advertised price)...they did not offer to exchange it for the red one.Nikon could have thrown in a little case for it though.Overall decent little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Valerie from Kansas
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine has a Nikon Coolpix L20 and loves it.  I bought 2 as Christmas gifts for an 18 year old and 23 year old.  Both were taking pictures and video within minutes.

Reviews.Title: Best little camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Ronald G. Palmer "Ron Palmer"
Reviews.Content: This is the first digital camera I've ever used. In the easy auto mode it takes care of all of the thinking. Lighting conditions, focus, it even tells you if someone blinked. I was testing out the macro mode and took a picture of a flower from about 5 inches. I turned the picture into a photo calender contest at work and won a spot on the calender with it. I have made 8X10 pictures of scenery and my wife and I framed and hanging on the wall. I am not a pro but the pictures are professional quality. I can't imagine anyone ever regreting purchasing this camera!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Ellen Carr "MacDiva"
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the Nikon Coolpix L20. As this is my first digital camera, I couldn't be more pleased with its ease of use and picture quality. I am sure there are better cameras, but for the price (under $100), this can't be beat. I am still experimenting with the many optional features, but I would recommend this camera to anyone, especially someone who is new to the digital camera scene.

Reviews.Title: No charger required
Reviews.Author: James Royce
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I bought this identical camera from Amazon. I like it because it uses regular AA batteries, not the weird-shaped "neverready" rechargeables that require me to carry a special charger around, and find an electrical outlet.  If the batteries fail, it's easy to find replacements anywhere in the world.  The camera also operates on rechargeable AAs, of course, and I can use them as well.  After I bought the first camera, my daughter saw it and liked it so much she asked for one for Christmas, hence the second purchase. It is easy to use and does a nice job of making panoramic photos.

Reviews.Title: fabulous camera
Reviews.Author: Elaine V. Seitsinger
Reviews.Content: I had a Sony before and this Nikon far exceeds in reliability. It is easy to handle and travel with.The pictures are much clearer.Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: Danielle L. Degraw
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  Good price, no issues, easy to use, and the software for the computer is good.  I find it difficult to get crisp pictures inside, but they are still good.  Outside pictures are great.  Good product for the price.  I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great First Impression!
Reviews.Author: Jdrez
Reviews.Content: Just ordered this camera as a gift for my daughter. The size is very nice; small but still easy to hold and operate. The controls are a bit different than my previous Olympus & current Lumix, but it is till very easy to use--I started using it before reading any instructions. The large viewing screen on the back is nice.  The first indoor photos on Easy Auto Mode didn't look that great, but regular Auto Mode worked much better. The flash seems okay; doesn't washout too much at close range, but the range seems fairly limited. The flash is certainly better than my 3 year old Lumix. The panorama function works fine.A few minor personal quibbles: I'd prefer the main mode settings being on a dial rather than a pop up menu, and I'd prefer not having the flash card & batteries under the same access cover.For an entry level camera is seems great, and for the price it seems an amazingly good value.

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: S. venugopal "SV"
Reviews.Content: This camera is worth for the money I paid. The screen is really big, which I liked very much. The picture quality is also good.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Randy R. Hermann "Camera King"
Reviews.Content: This camera is an excellent deal for the price.  Picture quality on its landscape settings and taking pictures of far away landscapes is poor but other than that this is a great camera for everyday use.

Reviews.Title: This is a great starter camera
Reviews.Author: K. N. Cornwell
Reviews.Content: I'm one of the last people to jump on the digital camera bandwagon and boy, did I luck out by purchasing the Nikon Coolpix L20 camera. It is very easy to use, just point and click with great picture quality. I'm very pleased!

Reviews.Title: Very HAppy
Reviews.Author: Bilal A. Aslam
Reviews.Content: Panoramic feature does not work for me. May be I am not using the proper steps.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolplix L20
Reviews.Author: Fred Maz "Fred"
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed with this camera. OK it is relatively cheap but I expected more from a Nikon camera. Every time the battery lid is open to change the memory card the damn batteries jump up out. It is annoying. It says 10,000 mpix but I looks to me like it is not. Overall I don't recommend this unless you have $120 to burn.

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality is weak
Reviews.Author: Michael Fong
Reviews.Content: taking pictures are easy as hell, however the quality is not as good as other digital cameras my friends have.  The pictures I take are usually blurry or not as clear as other cameras ive seen.  It was only like a [...] bucks but I wouldnt recommend investing the money in it, I mean spend like [...] bucks more and get something else.  Overall I rate it 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: Purchased for a senior
Reviews.Author: David R. Cline
Reviews.Content: No complaints.What else is there to know? Works as advertised. Inexpensive. Shipped timely. Full featured yet simple enough for a senior.Quit looking around and buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Worse camera I've ever owned!
Reviews.Author: LeosPets807
Reviews.Content: I hate this camera!  I've got more blurry pictures of my grandkids than sharp ones.  I've read so many blogs and taken every suggestion possible to no avail.  Thankfully, it's still under warantee, so I'm sending it back to Nikon, hoping they'll be able to do something about it.If not, this is my first AND LAST Nikon.  I am not happy!

Reviews.Title: Great digital camera
Reviews.Author: organic
Reviews.Content: This camera is so simple to use and the picture quality is great. It's the best digital camera I've had so far. You can add a memory card (which I did)and it will hold tons of pictures. It has a zoom and the screen is very easy to see and doesn't show finger smudges. It has a flash that will work automatically and it eliminates red eye. I like the message that shows up on the screen - "Did someone blink?" - it's so cool. Check out the specs and buy this camera if you want a very easy to use camera with great picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Too cheap
Reviews.Author: Jacob L. Mcentire
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cheap camera that took good pictures. I should have spent a little more for a decent camera, the money I saved wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Moosman "Mikes Cameras"
Reviews.Content: It is very difficult to take a photo that isn't blurry.  This camera is a piece of junk.  Don't buy it.  Very poor quality photos.  I bought this camera because I didn't want my wife taking my SLR on vacation.  She took this and it has a really hard time taking photos in low light, and if your subject isn't perfectly still and the photographer still, you will get blurry photos.  I am a professional photographer, and I have seen cheaper cameras do a better job. I am very disappointed in Nikon for selling this crap, becuase Nikon is my choice for SLR cameras.

ProductInfo.Features:
10.0-megapixel resolution for photo-quality prints up to 16 x 20 inches
3.6x optical Zoom-Nikkor glass lens
3.0-inch high-resolution LCD screen
Nikon's Smart Portrait System; Red-eye Fix, Face Priority AE and more
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon Coolpix L20 10MP Digital Camera with 3.6 Optical Zoom and 3 inch LCD (Navy Blue)
